12:07 <jomo> i'm totaly new in xwiki. Only downloaded the basic installer for evaluation. I'm looking for a wiki, what is possible set up as CMS, so for the guest users are here no "action buttons" like topbar and so on. Is here some sort of "CMS" skin? (ofc for logged users want a full wiki functionality)... I'm pretty sure than it IS POSSIBLE with xwiki, but i'm wondering that exists this already? (sry for my broken english)  
12:08 <@cjdelisle> The difference between wiki and CMS is how you set your permissions.  
12:09 <@cjdelisle> Without being logged in all you have are some basic action buttons but if you'd like to remove them as well you can either edit the velocity macro files where they are defined or you can hide them with a CSS hack.  
12:11 <jomo> yes, understand. As i said, im sure than it is possible - i'mwondering than someone developed skins (macros, ccs etc..) already, or will need start from a zero :)  
12:11 <@cjdelisle> There's nothing developed that I know of but starting from 0 isn't that bad when all you want to do is remove stuff.  
12:13 <jomo> ;) ok - thanx for a answer.  
12:14 <@cjdelisle> sure tihng  
12:14 <@cjdelisle> \*thing  
12:14 <jomo> btw, as i seen, the xwiki is now the BEST free wiki what exists... I'm (as a perl programmer) DREAMING for getting a foswiki to this level... ;)  
12:15 <@cjdelisle> Thanks. I've messed around with perl and the semantics make me want to gouge my eyes out.  
12:18 <jomo> yes, the %someting{}% is terrible with all $percent escaping and so on... ;) the only problem what i have, that im never coded in java... :(  
12:18 <jomo> (nor in velocity) - but, it's time to begin.. :)  
12:19 <@cjdelisle> Java is a very expressive language (even more so than C), you need 10 times the code to do what you'd do in any other language.  
12:20 <lucaa> has quit  
12:20 <@cjdelisle> Also we java hackers have a way of using UnreasonablyLongCamelCaseClassNamesWhichEachTellAStory()  
12:21 <@cjdelisle> If you can understand javadoc pages and you learn the (like 5) commands in velocity then you're set.  
12:21 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
12:21 <jomo> omg... from a point of view perl programmer (the only lang what i know a little bit) that will be a bit pain.. but nwm - foswiki is unusable for utf8 yet - i havent choice...  
12:22 <jomo> must RTFM a much - thanx :)  
12:22 <@cjdelisle> You can write in python, groovy and php (you need to add an extension for php)  
12:22 <@cjdelisle> \*and ruby  
12:23 <@cjdelisle> Basicly anything for which there's a JSR-223 scripting engine for, you can write into XWiki wiki pages.  
12:23 <jomo> in xwiki is possible write in python or ruby?  
12:23 <jomo> wow  
12:23 <jomo> that is nice

21:12 <mar3lis> has joined #xwiki  
21:12 <mar3lis> hey guys. i am kind of new to xwiki, but i have a question  
21:13 <@cjdelisle> yea?  
21:13 <mar3lis> i need to create a table in the database  
21:13 <mar3lis> how could i mange that?  
21:13 <mar3lis> hibenate syntax?  
21:13 <@cjdelisle> This is for your own stuff not xwiki I assume?  
21:13 <@cjdelisle> (xwiki creates it's own tables all automagicly)  
21:13 <mar3lis> yes  
21:13 <mar3lis> for my own  
21:14 <mar3lis> i need to have like a registration form to take classes  
21:14 <mar3lis> like in a university  
21:15 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
21:15 <@cjdelisle> You might find it easier to use the xwiki object/class system  
21:16 <@cjdelisle> But assuming you want to use raw SQL, you can get hold of the hibernate session like this:  
21:16 <mar3lis> because i'm new to it, i didn't came up with an idea how could i make it work with object/class system :/  
21:18 <@cjdelisle> {{groovy}} $xcontext.getContext().getWiki().getHibernateStore().beginTransaction($xcontext.getContext()); session = $xcontext.get(hibsession); {{/groovy}}  
21:19 <@cjdelisle> That should give you the Hibernate session (which is totally internal and unsupported api)  
21:19 <+jvelociter> mar3lis: you can check out http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DataModel  
21:19 <abusenius> has quit  
21:20 <@cjdelisle> Still, I would highly recommend looking at objects and classes as jvelociter suggests.  
21:20 <mar3lis> hmm  
21:22 <mar3lis> the think is i'm completly not familiar with velocity or groovy, but the task is to use XWiki platform.  
21:22 <mar3lis> i've been looking for tutorials with classes and object but there's only few of them  
21:23 <@cjdelisle> Do you know java?  
21:23 <mar3lis> a bit  
21:23 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
21:23 <@cjdelisle> Then you know a bit of groovy. Almost all java can be executed \_as\_ groovy  
21:24 <@cjdelisle> Velocity is simply a subset of java. Many of the more dangerous functions are removed.  
21:25 <@cjdelisle> Is you want to learn about scripting, here's the place to go:  
21:25 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
21:26 <mar3lis> the thing that bugs me, i don't know how to store the information using classes/objects  
21:26 <mar3lis> when a user registers him self to a class  
21:28 <mar3lis> create a class with parameters like it would be in a DB?  
21:28 <mar3lis> ID, name, etc  
21:28 <mar3lis> ?  
21:30 <@cjdelisle> When you're done, what kind of queries will you be running?  
21:31 <@cjdelisle> get users by class and get classes by user I assume  
21:32 <mar3lis> which user is registred to which lecture  
21:33 <@cjdelisle> so you create a class (actually it should be called structure since it cannot have methods) for a user and add a StaticListProperty which is the names of all classes he's registered in.  
21:35 <mar3lis> where could i find more info about how to impliment StaticListProperty and other data models?  
21:35 <@cjdelisle> Each student has their own wiki page and in that page there's a student "object" with the static list property. then each lecture has it's own wiki page and in that page there's a object which is the lecture's information (who teaches it etc.)  
21:36 <@cjdelisle> the student object lists the document names of the lecture documents.  
21:44 <mar3lis> is it possible to modify the registration form for the whole wiki, when a new user is registered, that automaticly there would be a wiki page created for him?  
21:44 <@cjdelisle> that's already how it works  
21:45 <@cjdelisle> but yes, you could modify the registration form to add another object to the new user class  
21:46 <mar3lis> oh so i could just add ant object with the static list to the profile page?  
21:47 <mar3lis> an\*  
21:49 <@cjdelisle> yup  
21:49 <@cjdelisle> You'd probably do well to read all of xwiki.org documentation and the code for some of the extensions to get a feel for it.  
21:50 <mar3lis> ar there any examples on how to use data model properties?  
21:50 <mar3lis> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DataModel doesnt say much about it  
21:51 <@cjdelisle> extensions.xwiki.org  
21:54 <mar3lis> well thank you a lot. you clearified a lot of things for me  
21:54 <mar3lis> i was about to make a simple php/mysql page with registrations forms  
21:55 <mar3lis> thank you for now, i'm sure i will be back for some more questions

22:17 <mar3lis> ?  
22:18 <mar3lis> with user list property for example  
22:19 <@cjdelisle> getDocument().getTitle()?
